intro: Euphrasia tatarica proles hirtella, commonly known as the hairy tatarian eyebright, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its hairy leaves and slender stems are adaptations to its wetland habitat. It is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported eye health benefits.
